alert.note: Alert for Southeast Fayette; Southeast Raleigh (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 6:20PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Raleigh and southeastern Fayette Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 619 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Stanaford, or near Beckley, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Beckley, Shady Spring, Beaver, Daniels, Piney View, Stanaford and Meadow Bridge. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 35 and 36. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 123 and 137. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern West Virginia.
